means: 剪羊毛( shear的过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She looks terrible, shorn of all her beauty and dignity.
sentence.Network_cn: 失去了美貌和尊严，她看上去糟透了。

sentence.Network_en: It was time for the sheep to be shorn.
He came home shorn of his capital.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的资本被骗光了,回到家里.

list.abs: He looked strange with his closely shorn head ., 他剃了光头后看上去显得很怪.

genuine spring lamb  当年春季产[一岁春季产]的羔羊收藏反馈  13.  shorn lamb  已剪过毛的羔羊收藏反馈  14.  lamb fatting  羔羊肥育收藏反馈.

entry.def: If grass or hair is shorn, it has been cut very short.
If a person or thing is shorn of something that was an important part of them, it has been removed from them.

example.ex: She looks terrible, shorn of all her beauty and dignity.
example.tran: 失去了美貌和尊严，她看上去糟透了。

example.ex: ...an age increasingly shorn of religious and political faith.
example.tran: 宗教和政治信仰逐渐丧失的时代

entry.def: Shorn is the past participle of shear.

means.word_mean: 1. having the hair or wool cut or clipped off as if with shears or clippers;

sentences.sentence: "picked up the baby's shorn curls from the floor"

auth_sentence.content: The wool is shorn, combed and when necessary dyed.

auth_sentence.content: The sacred idiom shorn of its referents and so of its reality.
